Based on your preferences for a movie about how small businesses are affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, I would recommend watching "Chain Reaction" (1996).
The movie tells the story of a team of scientists and engineers working together to develop and test the world's first nuclear fusion power plant, known as "Project Sunroof."
As they work on developing this power plant, they face numerous challenges, including technical difficulties, budget constraints, and regulatory hurdles.
Despite these challenges, the team works tirelessly to overcome them and successfully complete their mission of building and testing a nuclear fusion power plant.
In the end, "Chain Reaction" is a thrilling and action-packed movie that tells the story of a team of scientists and engineers working together to develop and test the world's first nuclear fusion power plant.

This movie follows a young man named Tom Hulce who discovers that he has the ability to teleport himself from one place to another instantly and effortlessly as long as he has activated his ability through thinking or imagination of him being in some place or doing some thing. The main conflict in this movie is between Tom's desire for power and wealth, and his fear and guilt over accidentally killing a woman named Kate LaNasa during a training exercise in 2004 when she accidentally stepped on a mine field under heavy rainfall. After Tom killed Kate during the training exercise in 2004, he immediately fled from the scene of the accident and was never caught or charged with any crime or offense for killing Kate LaNasa during the training exercise in 2004
